result.execSummary:
The defendant Preston J. Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Homicide, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.06(1).
  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: EACH COUNT: Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: consecutive, credit for 504 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with victim Angelica B. while in custody and during extended supervision.

Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
Anger Management.
Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes:
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
No contact with firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Preston J. Nelson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC.  Sentencing proceeded. PSI and materials provided by defense reviewed. Statements by parties, Angelica B., and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 25 YEARS, consecutive, credit for 504 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 15 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.

AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, consecutive, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment.
-Anger Management.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No contact with victim Angelica B while in custody and during extended supervision.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges, to be paid from 25% of prison funds, balance paid during Extended Supervision, failure to pay results in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Photos.
Received and Filed, Letters for Sentencing.
Received and Filed, PSI Report.
Received and Filed, PSI.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden in court, defendant Preston J. Nelson not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defendant's appearance waived. Parties request an adjourned Sentencing Hearing. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden in court.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: AMI  OFF THE RECORD.
Parties request Scheduling Hearing prior to Sentencing to discuss rescheduling of current sentencing date. Court grants parties request. Case remains calendared for Sentencing 4/21/2016 at 8:30 a.m. Case adjourned to Branch 24.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2 AMENDED
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or body armor after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. 

Parties request a PSI without recommendation. Court orders PSI without recommendation. 

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Case adjourned to branch 24 for Sentencing.

Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson and Katherine Halopka-Ivory appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Amended Information received and filed. Defense received copy, waived reading, and temporarily plead not guilty. 

AMENDED INFORMATION READS:
Count 1: Second Degree Reckless Homicide, contrary to Wisc. Stats. 940.06(1) and 939.50(3)(d), a Class D Felony. 
Count 2: Physical Abuse of a Child (Intentional Causation of Bodily Harm), contrary to Wisc. Stat.s 948.03(2)(b) and 939.50(3)(h), a Class H Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gregory Allan Renden and Deborah Susan Vishny in court, Defendant Preston J. Nelson not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson and Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for purposes of this hearing.  Status conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorneys Gregory Allan Renden Deja Vishney.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson and Katherine Holopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for final pretrial.  Court will be rotating out of this calendar and allowed defense to withdraw the jury waiver.  Court also granted the parties request to adjourn the trial date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 24.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  All parties were informed that as of December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Janet Protasiewicz, Branch 24 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Status conference scheduled for January 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
signed and filed.   rmm

Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorney Gregory Allan Renden.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Jury Trial Waiver received and filed.  Court finds upon questioning the defendant freely, voluntarily and knowingly waived right to have a jury trial.  State objects to defense experts testifying via videoconference.  Case remains set for final pretrial and trial.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.

Attorney Gregory A. Renden in court, defendant Preston J. Nelson not in court, in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense may be requesting a court trial in this matter.  If it is going to be a court trial, defense to see if a December date would work for the trial.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
signed and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Received and filed with court.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Bail motion by the state argued and denied by the Court.   Bail remains with the same conditions.

Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Non-confict put on the record.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
At the request of the ADA, the preliminary hearing is rescheduled to 1/22/15 at 1:30 pm.  ADA will contact the PD's office.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: ANGELICA B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Preston J. Nelson in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Preston J. Nelson in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
